无法禁用防火墙，因为设置了密码保护

This setting makes the app wait for the SDCard scan to be finished before applying rules after reboot. This is needed if you have apps that require data access and you moved them to the SDCard. Please note that this increases the time it takes for the rules to be applied after a reboot.
This setting enables or disables LAN support. This allows an app access to your LAN but not the Internet.
There is an error accessing the androidfirewall directory. Please export a rules file first.

Using Android Firewall
1. Click on Mode to switch between White List and Black List modes. 
2. Mark the applications that you want to block or allow (depending on the selected mode), for each interface. 
3. Open the menu and enable the firewall. If the firewall is already enabled, just select Apply rules. 
The rules will be saved and automatically restored when you restart your phone. 
If you want to check all current iptables rules, select Show rules from the Navigation Drawer. 
 
Widgets
To quickly enable or disable the firewall with a single touch, add the On/Off Widget to your home screen. 
To quickly change profiles or enable/disable the firewall, add the Menu Widget to your home screen. 
 
Firewall logs
If you want to see which applications have been blocked by Android Firewall, open the Settings menu and enable the Log. 
Android Firewall will then log each application blocked. You can check the log by opening the menu and selecting Show log from the Navigation Drawer. 
 
Password lock
You can set a password lock for Android Firewall by using the Set password option in the Navigation Drawer. 
To remove the password protection, just reset it to blank. 
 
App search
You can search for a specific app by typing the first few letters of the apps name in the search bar next to the spinner. 
 
Supported Interfaces
Along side the traditional WiFi and Data interfaces, three other interfaces are now supported. Support for VPNs, Roaming, and LANs are avaiable. These are enabled under Settings. 
 
VPN support allows apps to only access the data stream when connected to a VPN. 
Roaming support allows apps to access the data stream when you are roaming. 
LAN support allows apps to access LAN data but not the Internet. 
 
Tasker/Locale Support
Android Firewall contains a plugin for Tasker and Locale. The plugin allows those apps to Enable or Disable the firewall and change profiles based on different variables. For more information please read the Tasker instructions under the Profiles Help tab. 
Notifications from Tasker stating changes have been made to the firewall are disabled by default. They can be enabled under Settings. 
 
Other settings
 
IPv6 support is available under Settings for those who use IPv6. 
Users can change the apps language to one of the supported languages under Settings. 
SDcard support for users who have moved apps to their SDcard. Please read the setting description before enabling. 
 
Information
 
Media Server is required for YouTube to function. 
 
Tethering requires (root) - applications running as root and Kernel. Please use your profiles to quickly enable/disable those rules.

Rules Management is the ability to export, import, and delete rules files.
 
All user preferences are stored in the rules file so when you export a rules file you also save your Settings like notification support, log enabled, IPv6 support, and the rest. These files are used to create your profiles as well. 
 
Export Rules exports your current rules and settings. 
Import Rules imports rules and settings from a file. 
Manage Rule Files allows you to delete rules files. 
 
Instructions
 
Export Rules 
 
1. Swipe left to open the Navigation Drawer. 
2. Touch Export Rules. 
3. Enter a name for the export files. 
4. Touch OK to save the file. 
 
The file is stored on whatever your device considers its external storage in a folder named androidfirewall. The file name is the user entered name and '_af.rules' appended to the end. 
 
Import Rules 
 
1. Swipe left to open the Navigation Drawer. 
2. Touch Import Rules. 
3. Touch the rules file you want to import. 
 
After you touch the rules file you want to import, the data is imported and firewall settings are changed and rules applied. 
 
Manage Rule Files 
 
1. Swipe left to open the Navigation Drawer. 
2. Touch Manage Rule Files. 
3. Touch the rules file you want to delete. 
4. You will receive a dialog box to confirm the deletion. 
5. Touch 'No' or 'Yes'. 
 
If you touch 'Yes' the rules file is deleted.

Profiles are used to quickly change the firewall rules and settings. This is a very powerful tool as you may want a totally different set of rules depending on where you are or what network you are on. For example, when at work your rules may be very different compared to when you are home. 
 
Profiles are created from rules files that you have exported so you can swap between them quickly and easily if you ever need more than 5 profiles.
 
Create Profile allows you to choose a rules file and assign those rules and settings to a profile. 
Load Profile allows you to apply a profile. 
Edit Profile Names allows you to edit the names of the profiles in order to make it easier to remember what profile does what. 
 
You can swap profiles in a variety of different ways: 
 
1. Manually load a profile by using Load Profile. 
2. Load a profile by using the dropdown spinner on the main app screen. 
3. Use an app like Tasker or Locale to automatically change the profile based on time, location, or some other variable you choose. 
4. Use the Menu Widget to quickly change profiles from your homescreen. 
 
Instructions
 
Create Profile
 
1. Swipe left to open the Navigation Drawer. 
2. Touch Create Profile. 
3. Touch the profile you wish to create. 
4. Touch the rules file you want assigned to that profile. 
5. Touch another profile if you want to assign another rules files otherwise hit the back key. 
 
Load Profile
 
1. Swipe left to open the Navigation Drawer. 
2. Touch Load Profile. 
3. Touch the profile you wish to apply. 
 
Edit Profile Names
 
1. Swipe left to open the Navigation Drawer. 
2. Touch Edit Profile Names. 
3. Touch the profile you want to rename. 
4. Enter the name for the profile and touch 'OK'. 
5. Continue modifying the names otherwise hit the back key. 
 
Using the Spinner
 
1. Touch the spinner and a drop down with all the profiles appears. 
2. Touch the profile you wish to load. 
 
Using Tasker
 
1. Open Tasker. 
2. Touch the '+' and select the 'First Context' for what will cause the profile change. 
3. After you done setting up your context you will be prompted to 'Enter Task'. 
4. Enter a name for the task if you desire then touch the checkmark. 
5. Touch the '+' and a 'Select Action Category' screen appears. 
6. Touch 'Plugin'. 
7. Touch Android Firewall. 
8. Touch the 'Edit' button. 
9. Select which profile you want Tasker to apply. 
10. Hit the back key once. You may now test the Tasker profile by touching the 'Play' button in the bottom left corner.

Author: Jason Tschohl. Original Author: Rodrigo Zechin Rosauro 
 http://github.com/skullone/android_firewall 
 
 Android Firewall is a fork of DroidWall which is a front-end application for the powerful iptables Linux firewall. It allows you to restrict which applications are permitted to access your data networks.
 
This is the perfect solution if you don't have an unlimited data plan or care about your privacy.
